TopicTitle: I feel like the ender of threads.

Articles.Content:
It seems that every thread I post in recently dies fast.

Is it just me?
I think it would be cool if the forum generated user statistics for this. We could call it post-leprosy, of the pariah coefficient of something like that:)
Its a start towards an idea, but if implemented next forum update, how do they calculate older threads?

Its a start towards an idea, but if implemented next forum update, how do they calculate older threads?

Make it a ratio. Number of posts to which there has been no reply in over a month divided by total number of posts:)
We need to make sure this thread lives forever just to prove OP wrong.

You guys all just wish that threads would reliably end around you.

When I end a thread, it stays ended.

Yes, same here. I'd say its a timing and time zone thing.

I'm active on the forum in the evening, GMT+10 timezone.
Whenever I post in something, the posts regarding the thread/my discussion take longer than usual to get a reply. I feel ignored.

Sorry, had to sleep.

I agree with ROFL, thats how I feel.
I seem to get this as well

Whenever I post in something, the posts regarding the thread/my discussion take longer than usual to get a reply. I feel ignored.

Same here. I sometimes post a thread and end up with no replies whatsoever.
I feel like the opposite. Whenever I post in off topic it draws everyone back. Probably because it means the next wave of insanity is coming, as I live in the insane/enigma thread.

I remember that on ROBLOX, whenever I get to be the guy in charge of a group, the recruitment rate is sliced in half. Whenever I post on a thread in the Minecraft Forums, that thread is either a hot thread, or it will die in the next five posts, guaranteed. That's unless I'm the OP who's gone crazy ranting on how Apple sucks and how NASA is too slow in human spaceflight.

Its like this on KSP forums, but a little more mild.
